Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: oufan_DJ
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING! The staff is to notch! I will recommend this hotel to ANYONE who asks. This is Dallas best kept secret! Don't hesitate to book with Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JHNatural
Reviews.Content: We were not very familiar with Dallas but we felt right at home with the help of the the people at the Hotel Lumen. The staff was super friendly, especially Nikki. The restaurant was just ok. In general the hotel was in great shape, very well maintained. When we were ready to leave Nikki arranged a car to the airport, she is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: captain1965
Reviews.Content: The hotel is (of course) nice. It is across the street from SMU and in the park cities. The staff was nice and the room was very clean. The shower was large and very relaxing. The only complaint I have is with the room upgrade. I wanted a room with balcony because I thought this would give me a great view of the school and the beautiful neighborhood that accompanies it. I paid a little extra to get this room. I arrived in the room and walked out onto the balcony. It was then I realized that I had a beautiful view of a park cities alley. On the other side of the alley was a wall of a very expensive daycare center. I went down to the lady at the front desk and asked for a room facing anything but the alley. She was not very optimistic about my moving rooms. I had the impression there would be additional fees for the transfer. It also sounded like the same type of room would not be available. I probably could have insisted and forced a room change but I did not pursue it any further. I walked around the hotel and saw that the only balconies faced the alley. I would have been better off not getting the upgrade. Needless to say I felt a little dooped. It is still a nice hotel. Just be cautious of their upgradesâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Lumen is great will be even better after remodel.”
Reviews.Author: PVGreg
Reviews.Content: I live staying at the lumen when I visit my daughter in Dallas. It is a great location if you are visiting SMU or highland park village. They are finishing a major remodel that will double the size of the hotel and add a pool.

Reviews.Title: “The People Make the Place”
Reviews.Author: T_Ravel_Zona
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Hotel Lumen Dallas this past week with two colleagues for business. As a building there is not much very unique about the property. Its an old Ramada Inn that has been redone as a Kimpton but it lacks the quirky edge of most other properties. Not to worry though, there is a major expansion and renovation underway that promises to spice things up to Kimpton. The king size room was comfortably appointed and spotless as I have come to expect from Kimpton. The bed frames had an awkward length to them that, upon comparing, notes with my companions, all of us Whacked our shins on and nearly tripped over. That too will be addressed in the remodel. I had a terrific room service dinner from the hotel's restaurant "Social" that was very good. They made some adjustments to the menu and delivered a very nice grilled salmon filet with steamed vegetables and a fruit bowl that was not on the menu. What makes this hotel worthy of mention is the exceptional level of service provided by Mikki at the front desk, Felipe who handles kind of a funky valet set up with aplomb and Laurie at the restaurant who went out of her way with dinner. True professionals all and delightful to do business with. Thanks for taking such good care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Dallas hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Kennedylaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend of New Year's Eve at Lumen both for the holiday and his birthday. As we are familiar with Dallas (he went to college there), we have stayed at many different hotels with different price points. Lumen was one of the more expensive and worst overall experience. We were awakened before 8 a.m. Saturday morning (12/31) by work on the pool-banging, tile saws, men yelling to one another-within 20 feet of our dust-encrusted window. Our inquiries at the front desk along with other folks staying on that side of the building were met with the excuse that management did not know work would be going on and that they could do nothing about it. However, we were assured by management that no work would be done the following holiday and Sunday morning. We ended up purchasing ear plugs from the pharmacy down the street to get a little more sleep that morning due to the noise. After ringing in the new year that night with friends, being the old married couple we are we returned to Lumen at 12:30 to get a full night's sleep free of our two small children and mindful of our plan for reasonably early departure (10 a.m. or so) the next morning. Upon arriving at the hotel, we saw people lingering in the small lobby and outside the front doors. Upon entering, we were advised by other patrons that the key card system was "down" preventing anyone including management from accessing guest rooms. This sorry state of affairs lasted 3 hours with few updates as to progress in opening the doors as the manager was nowhere to be found and would only communicate cryptically thru a poor desk clerk. We got back into our room around 3 a.m., after standing around in the hallway waiting for one solitary gentleman tasked with checking IDs and letting patrons back in. We were promptly awakened New Year's Day at 8 a.m. by pool construction which we had been assured the day before by management would not be taking place. Again, management shrugged and indicated they had no control over the contractor doing the work. All in all my single worst and least enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - very tiny rooms with some oddities”
Reviews.Author: keylon
Reviews.Content: This is a great location just outside the SMU campus and a few blocks from the North Dallas Tollway. The staff were fantastic! The best I have ever met in regards to attentiveness and friendliness. The rooms were the smallest and oddest I have ever experienced at a Kimpton property. Room 205 was small and you were required to stand upon the double bed in order to change the thermostat. The bed was attached to the wall so there was no opportunity to scoot it over and access the control. The balcony overlooked an large brick building next door. I was unable to locate an ice machine anywhere in the building except in the restaurant. They are opening a new section next month and I can only hope they pay attention to the thermostat and install ice machines. All that said - it was lovely room and hotel- the shower was fabulous with multiple jets and very large. The only parking available was valet at $13 per night plus tax. When I asked about non valet I was referred to the 7-11 store a few blocks away. I'm told this property is a converted motor court hotel - that would explain it's odd layout. I wish there was a pool and hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ihatefakenames
Reviews.Content: The hotel works beautifully if you have a new student at SMU. Other wise, it's OK. The shower is nice, but the rooms are small. The suites work well to keep a student in your living room if you want them in with you. If you aren't doing womething with the school, then there are better places for better prices for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jlamb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Lumen on a lark, never staying a Kimpton property before. We were pleasantly surprised by both the staff and the hotel. Our room was fantastic! Huge shower and a very comfortable bed. The staff was welcoming and fun. The location is perfect, right across from SMU and convenient to downtown and everything in Dallas. Only a few miles from Love Field. We didn't bring our dog, but did see that they are welcomed and so we now have a great place to stay in Dallas when we travel with our pet. Very pleased that they don't have a size or weight limit for pets. All in all, it was a great stay and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Small-scale luxury”
Reviews.Author: Drujon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Lumen numerous times for short and longer stays. The staff is top-notch. It's small overall size reminds me of a European property, but the rooms are large, comfortable and clean. And it's pretty easy to get a good deal on rooms and I have often gotten an upgrade. The location is awesome, it's in the middle of Dallas, in University Park, directly across the street from SMU with easy access to highways and the DART train. It's 10 minutes to the heart of downtown and 10 minutes north to Northpark for shopping. I recommend the Hotel Lumen to European travelers looking for a good "home base" in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for SMU Visit”
Reviews.Author: GrayFamilyTravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lumen was very welcoming. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We spent the day on campus and were allowed to keep our car parked in the garage. Our room was spacious (especially the bathroom) and comfortable, with free wifi, two flat screens, and a kitchenette (refrigerator, microwave, and full kitchen sink) but no dishes, silverware, etc.. The style is more minimal (which we appreciate) but may not be for everyone. Our room also had a balcony, which provided a pretty view of the campus and surrounding neighborhood. The late night room service menu was limited (soup, sandwiches) and of average quality. Continental breakfast (included in our room) was good - coffee was great (in the lobby). They are building a new wing and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel staff to be very pleasant; most importantly the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. My room 225, was acceptable the design was a bit odd. The shower, sink and toilet were not located in one area, the toilet is in a closet sized room, the shower faces the sleeping area and the sink is just right of the door as you enter. I prefer that all the bathroom components are located in the same room not spread throughout. Also I found the shower to be lack luster it looks like car wash with multiple heads, the problem is there is not enough water pressure to use it properly. The main head barely produces any pressure and is much colder than the other heads, this issue was brought to Rachelâ€™s attention but they were not able to fix. Additionally, the closet was exceptionally small not barely enough to hold one suit and a couple shirts. A friend of mine was staying on the fourth floor where he had a bedroom, proper bathroom and a nice balcony with two chairs. Not sure how this room cost but I think it would be worth the increase. Overall my stay was not bad nor was it great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect comfort”
Reviews.Author: 2653adele
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Lumen are outstanding. Felipe, the valet has been there since day one and remembered us from several years ago. Andrew at the front desk couldn't be nicer. Susan, the bartender at Social is most entertaining and interesting. The hotel warmly accepts pets and consequently all the guests seem friendlier. My favorite room is #411, a suite with a wraparound balcony on the southeast corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but....”
Reviews.Author: pjcasey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lumen for a week for about the 7th or 8th year. The Hotel is nice. Some of the rooms are bit odd since it is a remodeled "motor court" type of facility. This time I had the worst room I've ever had. It had one tiny window that overlooked the construction site (the hotel is expanding and the new part is scheduled for completion next spring). The window was tiny and dirty so the room seemed claustrophobic. It only had a double bed. There was no closet, just a wardrobe that was not large enough to hold a week's worth of business clothes. But the hotel is clean, pretty quiet, and the employees are, to a person, pleasant and accomodating. The restaurant, Social, is good but probably not worth the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lumen is a trendy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BillRBirmingham_AL
Reviews.Content: My wife and two daughters stayed at Hotel Lumen in December of last year (sorry to be slow to add to TA!). We attended a wedding at the SMU campus and this hotel as the primary hub of activity. The location is EXCELLENT if SMU is your destination. The style was chic, trendy and modern as have been reported by others on TA. A nice change from the "norm" - despite the fact that my bias is for more "traditional". We stayed on the top floor of the hotel in a suite with a small kitchen. The dishes were limited but were enough for cereal and snacks. There was a full sized refridgerator which was nice for us since I don't recall the place having any breakfast. The room had two flat screen televisions, one in the main room and one in the bedroom. The room was comfortable overall. The shower was large and had a full glass wall. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet so we all slept well during a 4 night stay. There were some local places to eat within walking distance. A manager's reception took place on certain days we were there that included complementary wine and beer. I do recall getting complementary coffee in the morning but arrived shortly after the cut off time and was asked to pay. That was a disappointment. There was a trendy/modern bar on the bottom floor but it never seemed occupied by more than one or two couples during our stay (at least during our 8 am to 10 pm timeframe). The two things I didn't like about this hotel were the lack of a restaurant/food and the cost of valet parking. Granted the valet service was excellent but what do you expect when you car is literally within 50 yards of the door!?!? I didn't like being required to pay for this service but can understand this strategy given the lack of other revenue options for a small boutique hotel like this one. Overall, it was a nice hotel and I would stay there again. I would highly recommend the hotel if convenience to the SMU campus is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff - hospitable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: Lumen has nice rooms - and is well-located for those visiting Southern Methodist University. The rooms are modern, stylish, and well-equipped. Food through room service is good - and delivered "on-time." However, it is pricey for this locale. The staff is the stand-out here: front desk helped with every request sought, and ordered a town car for the return to the Airport. The Lumen is a hospitable place.

Reviews.Title: “Hereâ€™s a concept: a boutique hotel for the budget-minded”
Reviews.Author: George_PConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The more I travel, the less likely I am to stay at a run-of-the-mill, could-be-anywhere Hampton Inn, Courtyard, etc., particularly when Iâ€™m in a large city like Dallas. But I donâ€™t have the budget or the desire to stay in ultra-trendy, pretentious places that cost hundreds and hundreds of dollars a night. So the Lumen was a good choice for me. I got a real steal of a rate -- $130, including parking â€“ which made it quite worth the 30-minute drive to/from my destination near DFW. Being adjacent to the pretty SMU campus and Park Cities neighborhoods is a real plus. I arrived too late and left too early to take advantage of its proximity to cool areas. But there are plenty of places to dine and hang nearby, from what I understand. I will say that the photos on Expedia make the place look fancier than it really is. My room was sparsely decorated, and since I ended up in a handicapped-accessible room, there wasnâ€™t a glassed-in shower or a sleek vanity. In fact, if you absolutely need counter space next to the sink, you would be out of luck in this room. But especially for the rate, I was pleased. It afforded me a more unique experience than staying somewhere out in the â€˜burbs, and itâ€™s definitely a place that I would try again.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy. Style. Chic.”
Reviews.Author: StealingKitty
Reviews.Content: You can not get any better than this hidden marvel. Hotel Lumen is a small boutique hotel overlooking downtown Dallas that is BIG on style and comfort. The Premier Lux Suite is a romantic getaway waiting for you to enjoy. The large soaking tub can fit two comfortably and the aveda bubble bath is a fantastic delight. One of the best features of this hidden gem can be found in the thread count of the sheets. It is like sleeping in a dream. I highly recommend this small boutique hotel whenever staying in Dallas for business or pleasure. Absolute comfort without sacrificing any of the style or sexy.

Reviews.Title: “Wicky does Dallas in style & comfort”
Reviews.Author: brandoCessnock
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Australia for the Super Bowl experience My stay at the Hotel Lumen was a vey pleasant one. The staff, the room & the service were all excellent and I enjoyed my stay very much. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my family & friends - hope they have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Hooker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during the Dallas Ice Storm and was amazed by this little hotel. I stayed in the Lux suite. It is a dramatically(!) renovated old hotel that has valet-only parking, but very friendly and helpful valets at all hours (morning, afternoon and even 2 AM). The staff, especially the afternoon front desk clerks and the valet, did a great job and were very courteous. The key to this hotel is its eye for detail, which includes pineapple infused water out front, the wine social (which I didn't have the chance to attend), a $10 minibar credit if you're a Kimpton InTouch member. I also have to give strong props to this hotel having an in-room DVD player rather than taking the typical approach of pay-per-view. With a redbox and blockbuster quite nearby, this is an excellent little perk for guests. The bed is extremely comfortable and I thought the room was thoughtfully and tastefully appointed. The only odd feature of the room was the lack of curtains separating the living room and bedroom, which obviously wasn't an issue for me as a solo traveler but might well be an issue for those traveling with a family. The other thing, which is a love/hate feature, is that the rooms and hallways are fairly dark. Regarding the restaurant, I had two dinners and a breakfast there and was quite pleased. It is not cheap, but a place I would go back to even if I wasn't iced in. The short ribs in particular were quite tender and tasty. Make sure you join Kimpton InTouch, or the valet parking is $13 per day and the internet's not free.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced for poor quality, and very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: NikkitheTexasDoc
Reviews.Content: We had a suite - not cheap. The shower barely worked - no water pressure. Took an half hour to wash shampoo out of my hair in the drip of water. The alarm clock was non-functional. There is a kitchen - but no coffee maker, no plates, cups, spoons - no garbage can. The television in the main bedroom was outdated and poor quality. The robes provided by the hotel were VERY old and needed to be thrown out/replaced. They do have a happy hour in the lounge - with some free wine - which was good because then we had some extra glasses for the room. The soap provided for 3 people to use was 2 smal bars for someone the size of a smurf. The listing stated a king size bed - but it was actually a queen which was a shame as I was sharing with a friend and not a spouse. I would check out and move except I brought my pet as it is pet friendly and with 2 others staying with me - it would now be an huge hassle to relocate. Will not stay here again. With so many great places to stay in Dallas - SKIP this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great, friendly boutique hotel in a perfect quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: montecoreOregon
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything I need and like in a hotel, personal friendly service, EASY check in, walk from the car to the desk in 20 steps. Someone jumped out as soon as I pulled in, took my car, loaded my luggage onto a cart and directed me to go to the desk. I had a key and was on route to my room in a few minutes. The room was nice and clean, beautiful big shower and nice flat screen TV, as well as a super comfy bed. It didn't have a coffee maker, but they had complimentary coffee in the lobby at 6AM every morning and it was excellent coffee. They also had happy hour complimentary wine every evening from 5-6. The restaurant looked nice although I didn't have a chance to eat there. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: priscillaBurleson_TX
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lumen is a great hotel. The hotel staff goes out of their way to wait on your. The rooms are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience w/ potential to be even better”
Reviews.Author: 73x4n
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a night over to the Hotel Lumen for a one-night staycation for our anniversary. Here's what made a great experience: - The only staff we interacted w/ were the valet and the lady behind the front desk. Both were friendly and professional without being over-bearing. - The decore of the hotel is spartan/minimalist. In the room this comes off as modern and clean, in the hallways it feels a little utilitarian and cold. - We were upgraded to the premier suite (selected the option to upgrade if available at $5 upcharge when reserving). It was spacious and pretty much exactly as described on the hotel website. - The room was comfortable, the linens were clean, there was no noise (we actually did not see any other guests the whole time we were there), and we slept well. - BONUS points to the hotel for leaving us a complimentary bottle of champagne and some chocolates for our anniversary. Very nice and appreciated touch. Here is were there is potential to be even better (meaning: things we could have done to enjoy the place more): - We did not go to the hotel restaurant but peeked in and it looked well decorated and fun. - There was a wine reception in the afternoon we did not take advantage of, but were welcomed to and would have if we had the time. - Our room had a nice porch w/ a view of SMU campus that we didn't have time to enjoy. - Additionally, we saw signs in the lobby of coming additions/improvements to the hotel so that is a good sign the mgmt is continuing to invest in the property. Overall, I found this hotel to be a quality place to spend the night and would recommend it to out-of-towners looking for a spot that is a good value without being a mass-market chain place.

Reviews.Title: “PLeasurable Trip”
Reviews.Author: CJenkins23
Reviews.Content: When i travel I usually stay at Hilton hotels because I am an awards member. However, for a change of pace we decided to stay here on a trip to Dallas, and we were pleasanlty suprised! The hotel, from rooms to staff, was incredible! It does not even feel like you are in a typical hotel. The area is nice too, with all of the stores and places around there. All in all a great property, and we WILL be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Near SMU, great service, worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: tripholic
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on line, staying there for a conference at SMU. I walked to campus every day! Modern, spacious chic room, upgraded upon arrival. Valet service a little crazy, but valet very professional and friendly. Not downtown, but very close to shops and very nice area. Loved the room, had a lot of visitors but no one complained about the noise we made. I did miss the exercise room and pool, but relaxing stay overall. Oh, the wine and beer happy hour was a nice touch and I was able take as much as I wanted. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff Ensured Our Anniversary Weekend Was Relaxing and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: ryannix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our second stay at the Lumen. Both times we have stayed there for a relaxing, romantic weekend for our anniversary. Last summer, our stay was perfect and we were excited to return for our second anniversary. After returning to our room about 10 p.m. on the first night, we opened the door and thought we heard music playing in our room. It was actually from the room next to us. After listening to their music and loud talking for about 30 minutes, we decided to talk to the front desk. I was expecting the front desk to call their room and ask them to keep it down and that we would end up having to deal with their loud music for the rest of night. Instead, Michael, who was working at the front desk, immediately offered to upgrade us to a suite for the rest of our stay for free. He was very understanding and helpful and ensured that we were able to enjoy our anniversary trip. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing, romantic weekend together. Everyone at the hotel is very friendly and helpful without being overbearing. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking at Lumen”
Reviews.Author: davebPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: TravelZoo had an $89/night rate, better than anything Kimpton offered even to members. Great location, across street from Meadows museum on SMU campus. Valet parking was $13/night, with in and out privileges, same cost as self parking. However, I slipped my Subaru between a Mercedes and a BMW on well kept street, half a block from the hotel. We found street parking within a block four times. You may want to save the parking fee. One size fits all robes don't always work (6'2", 240). No tub, and attractive tile shower works fine from top head, not so well from three lower jets. Coffee in room is not an advertised amenity, but they provided a machine and coffee packets upon request. Bed is very very comfortable. Mini bar/fridge worked to keep our cheese etc. cold.

Reviews.Title: “fun change from standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: macyroo
Reviews.Content: This is a unique hotel. Great location..overlooking SMU..walk to quaint shops and restaurants. More like a condo than a hotel, but with wonderful staff! We booked the large king suite with a sofabed in the livingroom. Wonderful space with a small kitchen. Huge tiled shower( no tub) was very nice after a long day of sight-seeing. Look forward to staying here again. The hotel was full and does allow pets, so we did hear our neighbors a little. Also Social(the restaurant) is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at unique boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakeaustinboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. I've been traveling to Dallas for the past 2 years and just found out about this hotel. I will definitely stay here again. I stayed in a King lux suite, the price was very affordable. Very roomy suite, there was a full size refridgerator in the small kitche, living room had comfy couch with flat screen TV. The bathroom was big, had a huge walkin shower with four body sprays...this was an unexpected cool feature! The hotel is small with only four floors, directly across from SMU university. Quiet neighborhood, quiet hotel. Didn't hear my neighbors nextdoor like some other reviewers mentioned. Only downside, parking was the same price if you selfparked or valet parked.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like I slept in a closet. Non friendly workers, overpriced value”
Reviews.Author: febe41
Reviews.Content: Our room was $249 plus tax. We read the reviews and thought it was what we were looking for. We wanted a boutique style hotel, smaller establishment, but modern clean and fun. We first were greeted by the valet attendant who didn't seem happy to be working. Once inside, I waited in a small quiet lobby area in front of the check out desk for about 4 minutes before coughing loud enough for the girl to scurry out from the back. She didn't ask whether I've stayed there before, didn't offer any type of upgrade, whether at my expense or not, and didn't mention anything about the wine reception mentioned on travelocity's booking page. Keys were issued, and I'm not sure if she even smiled. It was wierd that our room was inside a Separate key-access lobby area. We had to key access one door to enter into a small foyer type area to find 4 doors, one of them being our hotel. Upon entering our room, my husband immediately said "there's no windows!?" That was surprising and wierd too. I've never experienced that in all my travels. I asked if it bothered him and we sat puzzled and thought it's not that big of deal.but by the time we checked out the next day, we felt as though we slept in a closet, like we were imprisioned. I never asked upon leaving because there was noone at the front desk again. I went back and looked at the travelocity website and there was only one style of room offered. Also, the bathroom was new and sleek but awkward. It was a sliding wooden door next to the bed, so basically it was part of the room- no privacy. The sink was a pedestal style but there was no shelf of any kind to put your blowdryer down, much less a makeup bag or room for even a shaving cream bottle. Once again, awkward and inconvienent. Why didn't she offer us to upgrade? Not sure, considering the place was practically vacant with roughly 20 cars between valet and the self parking lot ($13 a day). I left there feeling extremely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: larklaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days and excluding a quick room change due to a noisy a/c we thought the hotel was very nice. We upgraded for a very small charge to a larger room with a seperate sitting area and a completel enclosed bathroom. The first standard king room we were in had the showere basically in the room with a sheer curtain---fine for some but if you get up earlier than your roommate there is no way to shut the vanity/bathroom area off so you cannot get ready without waking someone up. Our larger room was nice-huge shower-very clean. Staff seemed very friendly--they have a nice nightly happy hour and offered hot cocoa one afternoon. The offer valet parking for a small fee but the parking lot next door is free and about 25 steps from lobby. Small gym area and hallway carpet needs to be updated but rooms were very quiet and clean and very comfy bed. Could choice if you want a quiet place with a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “best ever.”
Reviews.Author: baylorBUgirl
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend surprised me one weekend and we spent it together at this hotel. VERY sexy for couples. the shower was IN the bedroom literally! this hotel is definitely for couples that want a romantic weekend. It seems awkward if it were a family affair. Great service and staff. We're young so we usually get looks like we don't belong in swanky places like Hotel Lumen. Very afforable for us college students ($89 a night is a steal.) Beautiful atmosphere, right in the middle of a very rich neighborhood and SMU campus. :)

Reviews.Title: “Saved the Day”
Reviews.Author: MahaHouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel saved the day while last minute work was being done at my home. They got me a room at a great price, and my dogs were also really pleased with the room and service. Location also cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great style, great service”
Reviews.Author: JGinWI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lumen for 2 nights, and was very impressed with the friendly and helpful staff, who went out out of their way to be of service, and the stylish decor. The room was very large and comfortable, and the shower in a category by itself. Very convenient to SMU. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: dogdiggity
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4th of July weekend. Brought my (big) dog and had ample room in the top floor suite which had a nice size balcony. Am so grateful that the Kimpton Hotels are hospitable to dogs (of any size), which is so helpful to those of us that like to travel with our 4-legged family members. The front staff was friendly but not over imposing. The location is key if you know anything about Dallas. It is across the street from SMU and in the heart of University Park such that access to most parts of town is extremely easy. Did have one snafu with housekeeping missing my room but when asked to come and service the room, they did. Liked the quaintness of the hotel...not too big with easy in and out access. Overall it was perfect for our needs with our faithful friend. Plan to return in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Trying for trendy - the Palomar 2 blocks away is better”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to SMU - great if you want to be right next to SMU. It's 3 blocks from the interstate so easy access. The entrance is strange and hard to find. The place looks like an old apartment or other type residence building. The staff are great. The bartender is superb. The rooms are uncomfortable. Too much stuff in them and the space is too tight - doors bang into things when you open them etc. Breakfast is a disaster - do yourself a favor and skip it. The menu is limited - the food is below average - the service is terrible. Unless you have an hour to kill so eating microwave food seems like a good idea you'll want to eat elsewhere. I've stayed at the Palomar 3 blocks away and it is far better.

Reviews.Title: “European Style Hotel in the Heart Land”
Reviews.Author: foodisourpassion
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Germany for three years and extensively traveling to various countries in Europe, the Hotel Lumen would be a typical 3 star hotel. The rooms have the decor, and simplistic layout traditional of a European Hotel. The shower / water pressure is "ala" Germany where there is ample water pressure and flow. The Seinfield Episode where Kramer has illegal shower heads comes to mind because it is easy to want to stay in the shower for long periods of time (just don't wash the produce off in the shower)! The Aveda amenties are superior to those that you would find in typical chain hotels. Although the Lumen is not on par with the other Kimpton Hotel nearby, it is a very good value and has a great location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, quirky but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, with great location near SMU. Rooms were a tad weird with the entrance taking you directly into the bathroom and the shower being in the bedroom! Also leopard bathrobes and lingerie in the closet for "sale" was odd. While at hotel my very expensive watch went missing. Not 100% sure if it was left in the bathroom or taken by room staff but it was never turned it and was most assuredly "misplaced" at the hotel. The staff didn't seem overly concerned and were more concerned with assuring me that their housekeeping staff would never take anything that helping me find the watch. The only weird thing about that incident is that the night it went missing from my room, my entire group had their keys "canceled" and we all had to have them renewed at the front desk. No one ever explained why this was....

Reviews.Title: “well appointed, attractive, rooms need soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: traveladventures123
Reviews.Content: overall, our stay was very pleasant. staff is curteous and helpful. we could hear our neighbor talking and his phone ringing. otherwise nice one night stay

Reviews.Title: “Lumen is a great secret”
Reviews.Author: piv99
Reviews.Content: I love the Lumen, and if you like a "modern" boutique hotel done right, then you probably will as well. The beds are outstanding, the rooms and particularly the bathrooms are much larger than most hotels (especially compared to Kimpton's sister hotel down the street). It is definitely worth joining Kimpton's reward program because it will give you a great shot at getting upgraded I have found. The hotel does not have a pool, but you can use the Palomar's down the street which is one of the best pool scenes in Dallas on the weekends. You can't beat the location in my opinion: close to the Uptown scene but not too loud. My only disappointment is that the restaurant/bar is pretty dead every time I have gone there (always on the weekends). Perhaps it is more busy during the week. Looks great though! I stay in hotels in Dallas just about every weekend, after about 9 months of it and staying pretty much everywhere in town, I would say the Hotel Lumen is my favorite hotel in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: wsbull57
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and look for the extra special gems in eachg city for my home away from home. The Hotel Lumen is just that! I love the location and I found the staff to be among the best anywhere. I will definitely return whenever in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: tdee70
Reviews.Content: The lumen was a very good hotel, rooms nice and big, flat screen , small very clean hotel - great location staff excellent - restaurant unusal great food - deffinately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solorzac
Reviews.Content: i was there one night on business, it was really very good, i was pleasantly surprised - well done kimpton

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ericb67
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Hotel Lumen. I was in Dallas on business for four days and found my suite to be just what needed at the end of the day. I dined at Social once and had room service delivered from them once. Everything was delicious. The staff went out of their way to make sure I had what I needed. I will be staying at the Lumen again the next time I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the desert of concrete and steel”
Reviews.Author: rchgrca
Reviews.Content: Was on my way back from a business trip when I made plans to visit friends in Dallas. My friends made arrangements for me to stay at the Hotel Lumen. A boutique hotel in Dallas? Didn't make sense to me. I came to be quite surprised. The exterior itself is quite unassuming. You almost would never guess it's a hotel. When you walk in, an instant transformation takes place: from the concrete and steel of surrounding downtown Dallas, the lobby greets you into to a quaint, trendy, stylish, and friendly oasis. Make no mistake, you feel important when you stay here. The room lent itself to an unarguable charm. Many details were taken care of. The luxuriously inviting bed and minimalist decorations hinted of a European flair that reminded me of my hotel stays in Munich, London, Amsterdam, Madrid. The tiger striped bathrobes gave a cool, funky touch. But the real treasure trove is found in the hotel's bar "Social". It's charming and friendly atmosphere make you feel like a regular. I easily struck up conversations with other guests and the master bartender Lori. Speaking of, the master bartender Lori concocted a variation on an Absinthe cocktail that knocked my socks off! Wow! I will be a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: pjcasey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lumen for several days. This was my third time to stay at this hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated. The shower is good - once I figured out how to control it! The Social, a restaurant and bar on the first floor, has really good food. The hotel serves wine and beer for free to guests between 5 and 6 p.m. Newspapers ( NY Times, Dallas Morning News or something else) are delivered to the rooms every morning. There's free coffee in the mornings and, for the first time this year, bottled water and iced tea in the lobby during the afternoons. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. I had to conduct some business that required receiving and sending overnight mail. I also used the hotel's computer every day to check emails. The hotel is directly across the street from the SMU campus and there are many good restaurants nearby. I have nothing to complain about. This was a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tavelmomma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a romantic getaway. We were very disappointed in the size of the rooms. The whole hotel was very dark and quite. The bathrooms were nice but the tile was broken on the floor and it look like someone stuck it back on with toothpaste. the hardware in the large bathtube kept falling off. All in all we expected more and got less. Would not ever stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior27_8
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the Palomar Hotel in Dallas many times and decided to try the "other " Kimpton property when Palomar was not available. I agree with previous respondents who commented about thin walls- I was awakened 2 different nights by alarm and phone in the room next door. I did find the service to be quite helpful. I had many faxes coming with a work project and front desk was polite and helpful. The neighborhood around is very nice. Getting a cab can be tough-waited 30 minutes and was late to appointment as did not budget this much time. Room is new and nice although somewhat spartan. Restaurant food is good although service is somewhat slow with only one person serving entire restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalterNC
Reviews.Content: The walls are very thin, so when the neighbors next door came back at midnight and talked until 2 am, I heard every word (even though I put earplugs in and had a pillow over my head). Also, my room was in the same hallway as the management offices, so during the day, there is a lot of talking and conversing back and forth across the offices, which makes it very noisy as well. For some reason, they don't close the doors to the management offices. Also, be aware that their restaurant doesn't open for lunch, so you have to grab something elsewhere for lunch. It is a pet friendly hotel, and they have a lovely dog that greets guests at the front desk...but be warned if you have pet allergies. I had read the reviews about the shower in the middle of the room - it is very odd that the shower is adjacent to the bed except for a sheer curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lumen is in a great neighborhood in Dallas. It's a very small, trendy hotel. It's extremely comfortable, and they offer a variety of different rooms. Great decor and in-room electronics (generous LCD flat-panel TVs, iPod/MP3 player compatible alarm clocks, etc.). One thing I do need to add is that a few of the rooms are NOT family friendly; some of the rooms do not have an actual bathroom... the shower is right in the middle of the room, with nothing but a glass door and a see-through cabinet hiding it. Great for singles and couples, but I don't think this room would be good for a family... I'm sure you could request a different room, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel in a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this little hotel. The location was great - close to SMU, dining, shopping, Dallas Love airport and major freeways. The room was spacious, well appointed and the shower was gorgeous (glassed walk-in with multiple jets). I love Kimpton chain hotels and this one seems much smaller than others, but it was still really nice. I did miss the hot tub though - I usually stay a few blocks away at the Hotel Palomar which has a beautiful pool area. The complimentary happy hour was nice and the internal restaurant was good although a little pricey. The only thing I was disappointed by was the extremely slow checkout process. There was a single woman handling the experience and there were probably 10+ people waiting. She did not seem knowledgable in getting people served well nor quickly. I waited 30 minutes then just left (even though my bill was incorrect) because I had to be at a meeting. I called the hotel back from my office the next day and they were easily able to fix the issue. My checkin experience was almost as slow, but I was not in a hurry...

Reviews.Title: “University Park - The Place”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lumen on a recent business trip to the Big D and found the hotel to be a little jewel across the street from SMU. The hotel is nicely renovated with lots of personal touches. Nice lobby, bar/resturant, good room,gym and great shower. Inaddition to the great decor , is the friendly staff - who go the extra mile to make you feel weclome and comfortable. The location is a little suburban, if your not attending an SMU event - but with a car your 15 minutes to trendy Oak Lawn, Highland Park Village or North Park Mall

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton's Hotel Lumen -SMU Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: 1BayMom
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hotel Lumen. Our daughter is a student at SMU and this hotel is very conveniently located to the campus, art museum, shopping and neighborhood dining. Excellent parking both covered and in lot next door. The front desk staff double as housekeeping in the late night and were happy to bring extra towels and pillows to our large comfortable room. We have booked another stay in January and I look forward to the comfortable beds and bed linens as well as the shower. "Sister" Kimpton Hotel, The Palomar, is also an excellent and slightly more upscale choice within easy walking distance to campus and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: The Lumen's best features are its location (directly across from SMU), the comfort of the rooms, and the presence of bigger-hotel amenities in a more intimate setting. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the showers are, as others have observed, a fantastic experience. Flat-screen, wall-mounted TV, free wi-fi and clock radios that are also i-pod docks are all a plus. The only minus in my room was the smallish work space - perhaps the larger rooms fare better in this regard. I wasn't put off at all by the seated reception clerk, and was greeted by name by the reception desk and the car valet throughout my brief stay. I didn't mind the valet parking either, and I did not have to wait more than a minute or so for my car. Perhaps if the hotel is very full it might be different. I did not have a chance to use the restaurant, but there is a free happy hour reception daily. I will certainly return to the Lumen when I have business in the Park Cities area of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kai13
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel Lumen because of is proximity to SMU. The hotel was small and clean. The bed was comfortable and the location was prefect. Our only complaint was the walls were REALLY thin. We could hear the guy in the room next to us coughing ALL night long. It was so loud I felt like I was sharing a room with him!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable one night stay”
Reviews.Author: CSwan
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas on business in September and didn't want to stay in one of the big box hotels. I also chose Hotel Lumen due to it's close proximity to a friend's house. This hotel lived up to what I expect of a Kimpton property, smartly decorated, clean rooms and an attentive staff. My room was gigantic! I think I was mistakenly upgraded (a nice mistake!) to a junior suite, as my room had a separate seating area with its own flat screen tv and dvd player. The bathroom was huge. I really enjoyed the size of the shower. It could have accomodated at least four people. It's located across the street from SMU, so I imagine it caters to the students' parents. It's close to Highland Park shopping and about a 10 to 15 minute drive to downtown. Pricing (under $200) was actually a little less than what I expect to pay at a boutique property. Hotel Lumen is a nice change from the cookie cutter chains and you get a more personal touch. I'll definitely be staying here again for my next business trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcdkc43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Lumen in August and again in September, 2007, for a total of 6 nights. We had a two-room suite both stays. The room decor and hotel decor are modern, and we found it attractive. The rooms were very clean. Valet parking is mandatory, and is $10 in addition to the room charge. But the cars are parked in the building and valet service was excellent. The two rooms were very nice and had a balcony with plenty of space to sit or walk around. The suite had a standard size refrigerator but no range. There may be a microwave, but I cannot remember at this point. No coffee maker is in the room. The staff is very friendly and courteous. We enjoyed the morning coffee and the evening wine hour in Social, the restaurant. Newspaper at your door are the Dallas paper or the NY Times. The rooms are a variety of shapes and sizes. The view to the street side toward SMU is very nice. The view to the rear is toward some homes and apartments and is okay but not as nice. You may want to call the hotel and discuss room types and locations in the building. Keep your eye on the rates. They change with demand. SMU is across the street. I made a reservation for one stay about 3 weeks in advance. By the time we checked in the rate on the website had dropped 15-20 percent, and the hotel gave the lower rate. If you are a member of the Kimpton plan, you can get a room upgrade at no charge if space is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romanitc Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SH1234
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent the weekend here - what a great stay! We currently live in different states, so pick a place for a long weekend every couple of months. This was a great getaway location for us. There were lots of things to do nearby and the hotel staff was knowledgeable about local area dining and attractions. The rooms were well appointed, and the shower was great! The only issue we had with the room were finding small ants - it was a rainy summer in Dallas and I think the ants were just looking for dry ground. The DVD library was a nice touch - we spent one evening in the room watching movies, and the wine reception was a great way to meet others in the hotel and have a chance to visit. I would definitely recomment this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like a hotel; felt like you were at home...”
Reviews.Author: mantez16
Reviews.Content: This is was the first time we had stayed at a Kimpton hotel and we will def. go back! The hotel was very modern and stylish. We stayed in their Double Premier Room with 2 Double Beds. The room was only 310 sq feet but felt roomy for four adults. The beds had pillow top mattresses and were VERY comfortable. It didn't feel like a hotel at all. The bathroom was quite spacious. The shower was huge and we had a lot of counter space around the sink. The only bad things were: some stains on the carpet in the bedroom and we weren't able to turn on the Tv and refrigerator without calling the front desk for help. Appartenly, to turn on the Tv you need to make sure that one of the switches by the door is turned on. It would have been nice to have that written somewhere by the Tv. Also, we called in for extra towels and it took two additional phone calls to get them to our room. Those were only minor problems and we loved our stay at the Hotel Lumen. We would def. go back to any of the Kimpton hotels.
